get.summary: [EARLY ACCESS] ListAccessControlledResources: Get resources available for access control
get.description: Get the comprehensive set of resources that are available for access control

get.summary: [EARLY ACCESS] ListConfigurationSets: List all configuration sets summaries (I.e. list of scope/code combinations available)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Whether the configuration set is Personal or Shared

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Feature that allows Administrators to administer personal settings  (but never reveal the value of secrets) of a specific user.

400.description: The details of the input related failure

post.summary: [EARLY ACCESS] CreateConfigurationSet: Create a configuration set

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Feature that allows Administrators to administer personal settings  (but never reveal the value of secrets) of a specific user.

requestBody.description: The data to create a configuration set

example.description: All the config related to System A
All the config related to System A
All the config related to System A
All the config related to System A
All the config related to System A
All the config related to System A
All the config related to System A

400.description: The details of the input related failure

put.summary: [EARLY ACCESS] GenerateAccessToken: Generate a Personal Access Token for the current user and stores it in the me token

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
action=regenerate = Even if an existing parameter exists, forcibly regenerate a new one (deleting the old)
action=ensure = If no parameter exists, create one. If one does already exist, verify that it is still valid (call a service?), and if so, return it. If it is not still valid, then regenerate a new one.
action=default = If a parameter exists, return it. If not then create one. If this parameter is not provided, this is the default behaviour.

example.description: An access token representing the current user
An access token representing the current user
An access token representing the current user

400.description: The details of the input related failure

head.summary: [BETA] CheckAccessTokenExists: Check the Personal Access Token exists for the current user

404.description: The Personal Access Token does not exist

delete.summary: [EARLY ACCESS] DeleteAccessToken: Delete any stored Personal Access Token for the current user

get.summary:
[EARLY ACCESS] GetSystemConfigurationSets: Get the specified system configuration sets, including all their associated metadata. By default secrets will not be revealed
All users have access to this endpoint

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code that identifies a system configuration set

parameters.name: reveal
parameters.description: Whether to reveal the secrets

400.description: The details of the input related failure

404.description: No system configuration set exists with the provided identifiers

get.summary:
[EARLY ACCESS] GetSystemConfigurationItems: Get the specific system configuration items within a system set
All users have access to this endpoint

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code that identifies a system configuration set

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that identifies a system configuration item

parameters.name: reveal
parameters.description: Whether to reveal the secrets

400.description: The details of the input related failure

404.description: No system configuration item exists with the provided identifiers

get.summary: [EARLY ACCESS] GetConfigurationSet: Get a configuration set, including all the associated metadata. By default secrets will not be revealed

parameters.description: Whether the configuration set is Personal or Shared

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope that identifies a configuration set

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code that identifies a configuration set

parameters.name: reveal
parameters.description: Whether to reveal the secrets. This is only available when the userId query setting has not been specified.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Feature that allows Administrators to administer personal settings  (but never reveal the value of secrets) of a specific user.

example.description: All the config related to System A
All the config related to System A
All the config related to System A

400.description: The details of the input related failure

404.description: No configuration set exists with the provided identifiers

createdAt.description: The date referring to the creation date of the configuration item

lastModifiedAt.description: The date referring to the date when the configuration item was last modified

lastModifiedBy.description: Who modified the configuration item most recently

key.description: The key which identifies the configuration item

value.description: The value of the configuration item

valueType.description: The type of the configuration item's value

isSecret.description: Defines whether or not the value is a secret.

valueType.description: The type of the configuration item's value

ref.description: The reference to the configuration item

createdAt.description: The date referring to the creation date of the configuration set

lastModifiedAt.description: The date referring to the date when the configuration set was last modified

lastModifiedBy.description: Who modified the configuration set most recently

items.description: The collection of the configuration items that this set contains.

type.description: The type (personal or shared) of the configuration set

ConfigurationSet.description: The full version of the configuration set

type.description: The type (personal or shared) of the configuration set

key.description: The key of the new configuration item

value.description:
The value of the new configuration item
            
The maximum size for secrets is 4KB and for text values is 2MB

valueType.description:
The type (text, number, boolean, textCollection, numberCollection) of the new configuration item's value.
The validation for each type is as follows:
- text: any value
- number: double (e.g. "5.5")
- boolean: true/false
- textCollection: comma separated list (e.g. "a,b,c")
- numberCollection: comma separated list of doubles (e.g. "1,2,3")

isSecret.description: Defines whether or not the value is a secret

description.description: The description of the new configuration item

CreateConfigurationItem.description: The information required to create a configuration item

type.description: The type (personal or shared) of the new configuration set

description.description: The description of the new configuration set

CreateConfigurationSet.description: The information required to create a new configuration set

value.description: Value of the Personal Access Token.

type.description: The type of the Personal Access Token.

description.description: The description of the Personal Access Token.

ref.description: The reference to the Personal Access Token

PersonalAccessToken.description: Representation of a Personal Access Token under a Configuration Item format.

scope.description: The scope used to identify an entity

code.description: The code used to identify an entity

value.description: The new value of the configuration item

description.description: The new description of the configuration item

UpdateConfigurationItem.description: The information required to update a configuration item

description.description: The new description of the configuration set

UpdateConfigurationSet.description: The information required to update a configuration set
